DOC.HEAD: With AM-Hospital Mortality, Bjt
DOC.TEXT:
The Health Care Financing Administration released the names of 32 hospitals that had higher-than-expected Medicare patient death rates with this explanatory statement: ``The actual mortality rate at the following hospitals exceeded the upper bound of the range of predicted mortality for the `all causes' category for 1986, 1987 and 1988. ``This does not necessarily mean that the care at these hospitals was substandard nor that these hospitals are the poorest performing acute care hospitals in the United States.'' The hospitals are: Allen County Hospital, Iola, Kan. American River Hospital, Carmichael, Calif. Arecibo District Hospital, Arecibo, Puerto Rico. Baptist Memorial Hospital, Forrest City, Ark. Coral Reef General Hospital, Miami. Decatur County Hospital, Leon, Iowa. Divine Savior Hospital, York, S.C. Dr. Eduardo Garrido Morales Hospital, Caguas, Puerto Rico. Dr. Ramon Ruiz Arnau Bayamon Regional, Bayamon, Puerto Rico. Dorminy Medical Center, Fitzgerald, Ga. Earl K. Long Memorial Hospital, Baton Rouge, La. Fairfield Memorial Hospital, Winnsboro, S.C. Fayetteville City Hospital, Fayetteville, Ark. Hall County Hospital, Memphis, Texas. Harlem Hospital Center, New York. Humana Hospital Westminster, Westminster, Calif. Maricopa Medical Center, Phoenix, Ariz. Martin Luther King Jr. General Hospital, Los Angeles. Mayaguez Medical Center, Mayaguez, Puerto Rico. Metropolitan Hospital, Philadelphia. Monroe County Hospital, Forsyth, Ga. Oak Forest Hospital, Oak Forest, Ill. Ozarks Medical Center, West Plains, Mo. Plateau Medical Center, Oak Hill, W.Va. Ponce District Hospital, Ponce, Puerto Rico. Regional Medical Center at Memphis, Memphis, Tenn. St. Benedict Hospital, Parkston, S.D. St. Jude Hospital, Brenham, Texas. San Juan Municipal Hospital, Rio Piedras, Puerto Rico. South Washington County Hospital, Hollandale, Miss. University Medical Center, Lafayette, La. Yettie Kersting Memorial Hospital, Liberty, Texas.
The four hospitals that had lower-than-predicted Medicare mortality rates in 1986, 1987 and 1988 were: Green Hospital of Scripts Clinic, La Jolla, Calif. Rochester Methodist Hospital, Rochester, Minn. Roswell Park Memorial Institute, Buffalo, N.Y. University of Texas M.D. Anderson Cancer Center, Houston.
